titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I celebrated the Holy Communion at 8 a.m. There were nine clergy who communicated, and eight women.
Cruickshank came to talk over the proceedings at tomorrow's chapter. He is evidently apprehensive of difficulty.
At midday I received a letter from
(better known to my recollection as 'the lady Hypatia') telling me that her uncle my old friend Marsden, died yesterday.
After lunch I fetched Knowling for a walk; on the way we picked up Tucker, and lost Logic, who however, found his way back by himself.
